intro: Lucinaea parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved woodruff, is a herbaceous perennial native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, opposite leaves that are typically small and ovate, with a soft, velvety texture. Its flowers are white or pale blue, arranged in clusters, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Lucinaea parvifolia prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
